root.name: atan2()
root.description: Calculates the angle (in radians) from a specified point to the coordinate origin as measured from the positive x-axis. Values are returned as a float in the range from PI to -PI. The atan2() function is most often used for orienting geometry to the position of the cursor. Note: The y-coordinate of the point is the first parameter and the x-coordinate is the second due the the structure of calculating the tangent.

parameter.label: y
parameter.description: int or float: y-coordinate of the point

parameter.label: x
parameter.description: int or float: x-coordinate of the point
